definition: kopeck (unit of money, one hundredth of ruble) (loanword)
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: Gaby gives the goat her glasses.
sentences.chinese: 戈比把自己的眼鏡給了山羊。

sentences.english: The last copper copekcs of Tsarist Russia were minted in 1916.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇俄國的最後一批銅製戈比鑄於1916年。

sentences.english: The copeck was usually minted from silver.
By Tuesday, the ruble was kopecks away from that level.
sentences.chinese: 週二時，盧布距這一水平只有幾戈比之遙。

sentences.english: Several years ago the Museum of copeck was opened in Yaroslavl .
sentences.chinese: 數年前戈比博物館在雅羅斯拉夫爾開幕。

sentences.english: The history of a copeck is old and hard, but not to say very ancient.
sentences.chinese: 戈比的歷史源遠流長，但也並非遠古之物。

sentences.english: They say that withdrawal of copeck from circulation will lead to a significant prices growth.
sentences.chinese: 他們表示戈比退出流通將導致其價格大幅度上漲。

sentences.english: Experts are not very glad with the fact that the copeck is not going to be minted any more.
sentences.chinese: 專家對將不再鑄造戈比這一現實並非十分情願。

sentences.english: Go rent a buggy. For six grivnas.
sentences.chinese: 租上一輛馬車，花上六十戈比。

sentences.english: Gaby gives the goat some grapes.
The kopeck was given by an uncle from Russia.
sentences.chinese: 這枚戈比是一個俄羅斯叔叔給的。

definition: Werther, opera by Jules Massenet/Werther, German masculine given name
Pope Vigilius (in office 537-555)/phonetic -vich or -wich in Russian names
Apia, capital of the Independent State of Samoa
krone (currency of Norway, Denmark, Iceland and Sweden) (loanword)
Ur (Sumerian city c. 4500 BC in modern Iraq)
